item.title: Unni
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: Final year Computer Science student at Govt. Engineering College, Trichur. Proud Indian Python Freak. Luxurious Perl,C, C++ coder Cartoonist,Artist,Designer. Love working on GUIs Son. Brother. Lover. Friend. Get me here : kpnunni@gmail.com / kpnunni@chipmonks.co.in Want to hear my voice: +919895038236 (IND)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Call me back immediately.

item.title: My Cartoon Blog.. ;-)
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: 3.51 .a.m. Wednesday, 13 March 2008 : I have secretly started working on this cartoon blog. It has been in the coming for some time now, and before I start with anything else, it should be better that i explain the what? who? and why? of the concept. Its a habit of mine to make little sketches or "cartoons" (as I like to call them) of anything and anyone interesting that i see, perceive, hear or simply pops into my head. And that, my fellows will be what you will mainly see on this blog along with whatever I manage to write up alongside of it. That was the "WHAT" part. As far as "WHO", is concerned I like to be called Unni. I make cartoons, write code, like reading interesting stuff and stimulating music. I think you'll gain more insights into the more charming aspects of my personality soon enough. :-) "WHY" I'm writing this blog is actually quite rhetoric and I'm gonna let you guys figure that one out for yourselves.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: oh,i've seen u're drawings and u drawing in the class(actually in front of the teacher,cool!!) ,and i dont think u'll get enough time to upload all of 'em.
great... .start fast .. you can
ur cartoons are amazin.. i am a big fan of ur sketches..
a cartoonist,a skillful techie,and a love machine..u r truly an allrounder..:) PS: remember,i was an inspiration for ur cartoons during the school days..dont u dare forget that...
Why you so think? On the Internet it is! http://hasieah.goodaddress.eu/what-is-e3/map.html

Hey, great blog...but I don’t understand how to add your site in my rss reader. Can you Help me, please :)
I'm Out! :)

item.title: Snake Bite........
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: Python : This is my favourite programming language. The more code i write, the more i fall in love with wrangling this snake. Its natural that great minds aspiring for simplicity get hooked onto python. And also the fact that its quite easy to learn and code in must have something to do with its immense popularity. Its quite easy to learn python; and if any of you are on the lookout for a cool  interpretive language that anticipates your needs, I suggest you try Python. It may turn out that you need a bit of help getting started; thats fine. There are a lot of python junkies out there who revel in making a lot of noise about whatever they do (just kidding :)), so there'll be enough documentation available. Python has the added advantage of being a cross-platform language, so it doesn't really matter if you are a Free software buff, or just another standard Windows or Mac user. But you'd find it a much easier development session if you are working with python on a Linux distribution. Python is invariably a part of any Linux distro. But if you are a Windows user you can get python here. For those out there who wants to have a go right now: Linux User: take your terminal -> vim a.py -> type in : ' print "Hello World"' -> quit the editor -> python a.py Windows User: type in ' print "Hello World"', in your standard text editor and save it as a.py, then get your Python IDLE interpreter to run it for you. I've We've (team chipmonks), planned quite a few projects involving python. So I'll be writing a series of posts on them and maybe also something of a tutorial for graduate students and I thought this'll be a good way to start. Cheers. PS: Check out this tutorial on moving ahead with python. It comes straight from the horses' mouth.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hmm Great,
Go ahead .. I think you should work on a python tutorial for kids too.
By the way.. I expect something about chipmonks->chipdesk thing in your blog ..We may need some more attractive UI appearance there (like something 3D) ..

item.title: Summer of Code
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: This is a design I made the Carcode project initiated by Dr.Toby Donaldson. Catch up on this proj. I thought it was one cool way of initiation into the programming world. Okay so this was only a basic design. The project is some what in its infancy. There are still some cool features to be integrated, to realize sembelance of this design. Some features the project will soon implement : 1> An interface to design your own cars. It could be something like this. There can be provisions for uploading custom images of cars. 2> Next of course would be sensors fixed around the car. Pixel sensors are a mentioned future feature. 3> There should also be some kind of code-editor window: Check out some of my posts on the Pyneko project. I've integrated a code-editor widget in program. I'm uploading a pic. here. For more details see http://gnuvision.com/books/pybook/ PS. Please download the earlier Pyneko version and all its dependencies before downloading the improved version. Replace the neko.py in the earlier versions with the neko-unni.py file which you can get as the improved version before you run it. I thought the prospect of coding cars would be much more exciting than running a cat around,  (though the latter looks much more cute). Both Carcode and Pyneko targets novice Python learners. Though  PyNeko assumes nothing (being designed for school kids), Carcode targets a student community of the eleventh or twelvth grade with matbe some sort of programming base. The prospect of designing challenges for Carcode has a distinct thrill. 4> Of course more stuff will be added. Check out :http://code.google.com/p/carcode/wiki/CarcodeVision

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Gud Work dude.. You could have included grids in the picture like in neko..

item.title: Go Neko......
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: Check this out. Pyneko -cat out of the bag. It is a project initiated by my guru Pramode.C.E to teach programming innovatively. The project is just in its first-steps stage. The current version that will be available to you all will require python running from a terminal controlling actions of neko using built in functions. It should look something like this: It occurred to me that it was quite a drag to have to write code in one window and watch your cat run around in another. I decided to muffle the grumbling and integrate to the UI provisions to write and edit code for neko, run single commands and watch neko perform, all within the same window, complete with a skeleton help index and tutorial. The newer version will soon be available as soon as I'm sure that the code will meet with Sir's approval. Meanwhile, try putting neko through its paces, and rest assured that it will be cured. :)

item.title: Summer time.......
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: Its that time of the year again. A time when all the undergraduates of the globe whip out their systems, infest all the IRCs they have ever heard of, crack away at their keyboards trying to write pleasing applications and lure mentors. :) Just kidding...... The google Summer of code is quite an inspired idea if you ask me.  And if you can write decent code, I'd say go for it. GSoC 2008 seems to have a much wider participation than that of last year. Only goes to show how the world is reacting to the open souce way. Exams are upon me now and I have come without a single arrow within my quiver. They keep telling me i discovered a thing called 'The Classroom' and accept the existance of books.

item.title: I Got In !!!!...............
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: Yes, my dear ladies and gentlemen, it is true. Yours truly has managed to make the cut. My application was selected to participate in this year's Google Summer Code. I think ecstatic would about cover what I'm feeling at the moment. ;) I'm so plussed, I'm gonna borrow a toon this time.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: congratssssssssssss

hi! But you are supposed to respond to your GSoC mentors... :p
regards VK
again ur magnificient oratory got u there........ hail batusaiii
for those who came in late, batusai is a great samurai whom i happen to adore. I think i'll put up a post on him soon

item.title: New Neko !!!!!!!!!!!!
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: I've finished it ! The Pyneko program is now stand-alone. Pyneko now boasts a command entry widget, for yours' truly is happily responsible :). The modified version can be found soon here And that, my friends is what the new and improved Pyneko looks like. Neat, don't you think ? :)

item.title: Crammed!!!....
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: It happens so that every year I find my hands crammed with things to do, stuff to get, places to be and EXAMS!. It is that time of the year again, and invariably I am in the midst of a hustle. The FOSS meet at NIT-C happened to coincide with God's favorite form of torture - University Exams. It also very conveniently seemed to fit into the two weeks that google chose to listen to the Summer of Code hopefuls. And when all roads lead to NIT-C, I am left behind. Trying to cram my head with concepts of Theory of Computation and while spell checking my third Summer of Code proposal. :( So away from the masses, I gave up my laptop to my friends for the day. And for the first time since its advent, the machine has had MS Windows XP running on it. Rather than being disappointed, I decided to write this post using XP. Check out the toon I made using MS Paint. I use KolorPaint to make my toons usually. And in another fork of events, Blog Mania has hit the Men's Hostel. You can see people cracking away at systems, writing new posts and uploading pics, thinking up innovative names for crazy blog concepts. I've added two of them I think will outlast the surge of a sudden rush of creativity on my blogroll. Check out Ajmal's and Ajith's Blog.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: true in every sense....exams beat the heck out of everyone..

item.title: The Theory of Bliss...
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: O happiness! our being’s end and aim! — Alexander Pope The fingers were now rebelling against the cruel overkill. It was now exceedingly difficult to keep the eyes from wandering towards all those free souls outside, waiting, oblivious to  the  exertions  of the gray muscles within the hall. Every heart beat of the wrist watch seems to be egging me on to leave. I run my eyes over the feeble , but brave, attempt to answer the questions posed; Theory of Computation seems to be a bit beyond my grasp, after all. 'Enough is enough', unless God manifests himself in the form of a cipher to all the gibberish on the question paper in the next ten minutes, my answer sheet that looks like a disarrayed battlefield is not going to benefit of staying in the same room as me. One last prayer and I tie up my answer sheet and step out- into the LIGHT!. Bliss!. Sweet oblivion. It has finally ended. The novel manifestation of capital punishment- Examination- is now officially come to an end. :)

item.title: I don't know what to call this post!
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: Against stupidity the gods themselves contend in vain. - Friedrich von Schiller The world is still round, the sun is still shining. All seems bright and beautiful. My internet connection is back! :) :) :) All the cables had been cut! Yes! Some cruel vengeful soul had cut the cable lines that carried all the bytes of data I wanted to transmit from my room. I would have forgiven that dilapidated being, had they been able to repair the problem on time. But the fates were conspiring against me; it took them a never-heard-of-before FIVE days before I could check out my mail. And as a result I had to spend my birthday ( that I share proudly with Rubin "Hurricane" Carter ) climbing up trees in my hostel compound, kicking away at a random football and eating my way through what would have fed an entire army.

item.title: Goooood Morningggggggggg GEC...............
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: I was absent from the world wide web for a few days. My absence was due to some end of the term work I was forced to finish. What was I up to these three days? Well, among other things we got a campus radio up and running. It was something on the spur. We had an open house exhibition at our college [Govt. Engineering College Trichur] and we hosted a campus radio using the college LAN and Icecast. Visit our community: here mail us: gecRadio@chipmonks.co.in The whole thing was a smashing hit. We had speakers installed at all our listening points in all our labs. Requests for songs and phone calls came pouring in. But this was just a temporary set up. We plan on continuing the radio on a more permanent basis. Maybe we could get permission to transmit our radio via FM. We've been talking to the authorities and it seems we could get through the necessary formalities in a couple of months. We are going to need a lot of help setting up this radio. Anyone who can help please leave your contact details as a comment and I'll get back to you. Or please mail me at kpnunni@gmail.com.

item.title: Whats up with Animations, eh?
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: My friends informed me, after watching me "painstakingly" piecing together another one of my little doodles, "Whats the big deal? Anyone with a good drawing tool could do that"; Hmph! I strive to remain unconcerned. "What then?", I haughtily ask, "What then, do you propose?" "Animations, dude! Thats where the money lies. Can you make any one of your drawings move?" All right. I take up the challenge: The Gimp gave me this after a few tries - That looks all right. Now I try something bigger. Its pretty simple actually, to create animations with the Gimp. Heres how to do it This one was much more satisfactory to make :) All right. So I'm hooked. I think I'll put in more animations in here. Footnote: By the way, did you notice that the last three of my drawings looks like they are vector illustrated? Actually I used Kolourpaint to make these drawings and then I used this simple tool: autotrace. [ autotrace drawing_file >vector_drawing_file ]. But if I were you I would use it only for those sketches in black and white. Colours don't go well with autotrace. I'm still trying to get the Pencil tool to work on my Debian box. I've all but given up. If anyone out there has overcome this particular hazard or think that the actual hazard is my innate stupidity, please enlighten me.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: brillant work in gimp..
what about animation using svg?i had some basic lessons.it seems FS Browsers support them,anyway:) i had heard that firefox is gonna support apng(animated png) donno whether firefox 3 has it or not.
What is the problem with pencil tool. Elaborate may be we can fix this...

The libraries in Debian are too old. I hit a snag with the libming library. Once i fixed that libstdc++ was shown as outdated. The debian etch provides 1.6.95.4 by default and pencil requires versiond >=4.2.1.

item.title: I saw a movie........
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: All right folks I finally saw a movie that is re-watchable: IRON MAN It is worth getting myself to the theater once more just to watch all the cool "tech" stuff featured. Man!, would i like to get my hands on some of those. I had a few friends with me. And all the un-awoken engineering spirit was kindled within their souls at the sight of those projected future machines. It is funny,  how what man has already achieved is always so trivial next to where his mind now soars. Sometimes I wonder if this "developed intellect" is not, after all, a curse. The constant drive for something better is quite a thrill, I admit. But forget not my friends who quote Frost's famous lines, "..And miles to go before I sleep", when asked to slow down and breathe for a while , this poem titled LEISURE by Wm. Henry Davies What is this life if, full of care, We have no time to stand and stare. No time to stand beneath the boughs And stare as long as sheep or cows. No time to see, when woods we pass, Where squirrels hide their nuts in grass. No time to see, in broad daylight, Streams full of stars, like skies at night. No time to turn at Beauty's glance, And watch her feet, how they can dance. No time to wait till her mouth can Enrich that smile her eyes began. A poor life this if, full of care, We have no time to stand and stare.

item.title: Of Viruses and Crack-heads........
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: All you windows users out there, I know you are old hands at being infected so this may not sound intriguing at all. I have a Windows XP installed on my box. My brother insists that it is much simpler to play Need For Speed on Windows ( wonder what gave him that idea ) and thus by forcing my hand via the long arm of parental law has managed to retain the XP alongside of my Debian Etch installation. My friends also use Windows on my laptop. The other day, on return from a most gratifying visit to the hostel mess, I found my machine with XP booted up, unmanned, anti-viruses flaming with protests of some security breach. I sat down to see what was wrong and found out that some nut called Ahsan had taken over ( God!, I hate mentioning that crack-head's name! ). Check out my friend Anil's blog for the gory details. Well it takes one crazy guy to catch one. Anil did catch this virus which had stumped most of us and some of the more common safe-gaurding softwares. And he has posted on how to get rid of you-know-who.  I really love having ANF to do what needs to be done.

item.title: The benifits of working late.............
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: I burn a lot midnight oil when I'm working on something. I work late, though not necessarily hard, and I find it find that brain works much better in the dark. Curious isn't it ?, how something I could never achieve on the eve of examination seems like child's play when you do something that you love. ( And that doesn't mean I don't like exams, mind you :) ) There are some unique advantages to working late. Your brains starts working at speeds that you didn't think was possible for one. You are able to roam unharnessed around the cloaked hostel grounds and the college campus, which in a manner inspires creation. And then there is always the fact that the night air does wonders for skin texture. It was dark, and I had decided a stroll at 3.a.m. would certainly revitalize my tired circuits. I was working on something and having had little success, sleep was not an option. I got out of the hostel and turned right, heading for the college campus. There was a figure some distance front of me. I peered. He was holding a mobile phone to his ear and purring away in the mouth piece. An aching heart ; I smiled. Turning away from our friend with the aching heart, I walked on towards the hostel mess only to find one more estranged soul perched on the steps with (yep!, you guessed right) a mobile glued to his ears. Hokay!, weird. Wondering how these guys could actually stay awake talking I moved on. Only to be confronted by yet another mobile-talking-wonder!. My eyes sweep around, taking in the hostel and its premises. My jaw dropped of its own accord; the window-sills, the door steps, on top of all the bikes were sitting patient listeners, solemnly enduring their loved ones' crooning. ( I even found one up a tree! ). What is with these girls anyway? How they manage to wake up at these ungodly hours and keep whispering into their phones is fairly beyond me. It would take nothing short of an act of God to have me doing that at this hour of the night, ......unless.......yes!...........its........my phone........and its ringing..... :)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: The thing u last written in the para is the fact. I hav one doubt ..Do u hav time 2 look around the hostel premises. i dont think so. U wil b free from phone only wen ur girl friend is with u...
can't stay from commenting .. Really a ' post ' it is ..I think you have a good imagination of yourself as the guys at hostel premises ..
Yes I realize this post might blemish my " image " just a bit. But I just couldn't resist! ;)

item.title: Pythonify...........
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: Hi all. For the sake of those who did not know, I am quite in love with Python. So I decided its time I showed more devotion. So I'm launching a Python Blog check http://pythonify.wordpress.com. I shall qoute all I write on it over here but I'm putting all major articles on Python over there. I've not decided on whether or not to put toons on that blog. Overkill, do you think?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: A good one ..Nice design .. And you may have pics in pythonify.. related to GUIs ..

item.title: Swirl with Perl
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: Following my Python Blog. I'm also announcing the release of my next literary + coding venture : Swirl with Perl. Thats a Weblog too. Its destined to contained my more rash experiments in Perl. But for now I think I'll Just let it carry details of my Google Summer of Code project , that is, implementing full text search for Bricolage. I think either my mentors at Bricolage will be pleased or I'll have my ass kicked out to the Antartic :)

item.title: "Teri Aankhon ke siwa Duniyan mein rakha kya hain............"
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: Its a song by the great Muhammed Rafi. It goes without saying that I'm a huge fan. I chose this title for a post on the better things in life like friendship, books, footbal, calvin & hobbes ......... I'm gonna be highly irregular here. I'm writing without a compass and I'm writing on few things that make life worth all the trouble of breathing while I infest the dilapidated rooms of my college hostel. Once in a while I go on "cynic" mode. But even then some things never loose their charm. Like this Calvin & Hobbes cartoon............. God ! I wish I could draw like that. The man who made those strokes is my hero. He is Bill Watterson. I guess Hobbes has summed up pretty well how low I'm feeling right now. How beautiful would it be sprawled on the grass, amongst trees, reading your favourite book, listening to your favorite music, eating french fries off a plate delicately balanced on your chest. Ah! that would be the life........ You know what I think I can give it a try. I might be able to at least give it a shot. I'm gonna get my pens and colors tomorrow and make some sketches andthen I'll scan them and post them. Wait.

item.title: I got a book!
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: Okay so this guy from FedEx calls me up. "Sir", he calls me (immediately kindling my interest ;) ), "You have a package from the States". "Ah! yes. I've been expecting it.", I shout happily. My friends Jerry and Pradeep came along with me to the local FedEx office. They gave me a book shaped package tightly bound in a white, synthetic, plastic-like cover. Yes, I knew it was a book!. Google had sent me a gift to congratulate me on my acceptance into the Google Summer of Code Programme. I hastily unwrapped the package and showed off my book to my pals with a huge smile on my face. I had been sent 'Beautiful Code' from O'REILLY. I held it up proudly. This was proof of a dream come true. :)

item.title: Liquid, Solid and Smoke....
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded:
We got together today after deciding that it was a beautiful day to celebrate.
Just the five of us. A couple of beers, some whiskey and yours truly sipping on the strongest beverage his countenance can tolerate - PEPSI ! ;0 .
Yep! I do that once in a while; you don't necessarily have to drink to have a wild time. ;)

item.title: The Dark Knight returns...... and so do I..........
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: I won't as much as go to the extent of declaring "Batman 2 - The Dark Knight" as the greatest movie to ever have been filmed, but its right up there all right. After witnessing an awesome performance by the late Heath Ledger, which no words could possibly describe, the Batman movie has now outclassed every other movie of its genre by miles (at least). The Joker has mesmerized me back to life, and back to blogging.( the fact that my exams have now come to an end must have helped just a wee bit).

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: yah..pretty awesome movie...heath ledger truly deserves a posthumous oscar..

item.title: Me ,Eddy and Drupal.........
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: On this fateful day, the loyal eddy and I took up the heavily knuckle-bruising task of our new Drupal website. For those that remain blissfully oblivious to hazards of drupal configuration, I'd only recommend it as a nerve-wrecker of epic proportions if you don't know what you are doing. The drupal decision for our event site- hackerdom.in was forced upon me. I knew i'd be a bit off my game playing ball with it. I would have opted for something a bit more up my alley, like Bricolage for instance. Since the "romans" thought drupal was their cup of tea, I did as they did. Anyways, gittery as I might have been, the decision was not such a farse after all.(Although with an ever-optimistic Eddy at your side its much easier to take :) ).

item.title: Project Days.........
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: The last three days saw me running about with laptops trying to get mini-projects for my college running. Actually, my schedule was less cramped than my friend Anil's. It happened thus that the mini-projects in our class were "core-dumped" on our heads. On top of which we had to work a wee bit harder on our project. Anyways, I believe the three musketeers (Anil, Sreeraj and me) did come out with a few feathers on our caps. You guys can check out Anil's blog for the more gory details. Anyways I'll go into a more detailed picture of our project: Beneath its flamboyant title of ChipBluez0.1, lies a simple easy to use pc suite for nokia s60 phones with bluetooth. More details to follow, when we release it officially under the  GPL .

item.title: When Hard work pays off
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: We all enjoy working and its been one of our most exhilerating moments when we finally launched our event site hackerdom.in. Albeit not completely finished we were still thrilled when at 6.30 .a.m on the eigth of October we could finally say that it had ninety percent of the elelments required for an event site, after an overnight hustle to launch the site before the Swanthatra Malayalam Computation's KDE(malyalam) launch. After two nights of hard toil Eddy, Anil, Khedar and me finally called it a day and gave into pure exhaustion, but with smiles on our faces. Khedar is really to be congratulated for his brilliant artwork.
item.category: dept. of computer science and engineering

item.title: When Hardwork takes its toll
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: I just simply can't beleive it! Edwin! and that too right before my own eyes.................. All of us, (Anil,Eddy, Sreeraj and me) were at Trivandrum Central Station having arrived by the Guruvayoor-Trivandrum express at four in the morning after a tiresome journey with sparing amounts of sleep. Declaring that sleep was what he needed more than coffee bhai (as we fondly liked to call Eddy) rested his head on Anil's shoulder while Srj made some fleeting joke on how we didn't have any sleep for the last few days. Bhai stretched out his arms in an attempt to rejuvenate his tired body, when all of a sudden he just dropped on to the concrete platform floor banging his head (which we didn't realize at the time). Knocked out with fatigue, is what we figured........ On taking him to the Cosmopolitan  Hospital, the doctor's conformed our worst fears and declared his condition to be critical. He was vomiting blood and was in a semi-drowsy, semi-conscious state. The next day his severe internal hemorrhage and skull fracture was conformed. He is now in the ICCU of the Cosmopolitan Hospital, Trivandrum. After two torturous days the doctors have finally started saying that his case is hopeful and though it may be a bit slow, a recovery should happen. Pray for my friend. He was the best of us. P.S. I thank the whole Swathanthra Malayalam Computation Team for their support and especially Anivar Aravind and Anoop John who came to our aid at the hour of our greatest need. I also thank Lord Almighty for safe-gaurding Bhai from deeper danger.

item.title: Counternotions.....
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: I have been an inmate of my college hostel for the past three months, and I must say that i find the lifestyle rather to my liking. The belief in ordered chaos and the utter disregard for conventional notions of cleanliness and habit are prominent.

item.title: What Indians don't need to know..........
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: Today is the 62nd Independence day of my beloved India, and I digress at my plight of having to write a most cynical piece on such a bright day. The truth is that I find myself so filled with hope this morning that I feel what hampers my hopes for my nation should be written about.

item.title: The Hackerdom Curtain Raiser
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: The official announcement of Hackerdom is scheduled for the 29th of August at Trichur. Everyones Invited ;) For details check: http://hackerdom.in

item.title: We're Hacking Again.......
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: After a "short" break I return to active coding/hacking. What with my laptop getting ruined when my friend Edwin fell  on top of  (read previous  posts)  and  what with a  flurry  of  exams, i've been out of touch with my hacking-karma for the last four two months or so. So now we, the chipmonks, are at it again. We're trying to develop some self-proclaimed cool projects which we think could earn us a quick buck.

item.title: Qt Workshop at AWH
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: The Free Software Users Group, Calicut organized a Qt workshop at the AWH Engineering College at Kozhikode for their MCA final year students. I was asked to introduce them to Qt Programming and Application Development and I chose to do it in Python. I thought this might be useful for those of you who are searching for an easy and powerful means of creating GUI-driven applications which are platform-independent. So I'll be posting my "class" and a few examples that we tried out. Check my Python-blog for details.

item.title: Bloggin Again..... and this time its Better......... !!
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: All righty then. I'm back.... !! "Again ??" Yup ! :) So now what am i upto??, This....... For those previously unblessed with the heavenly vision that i am ( :P ), I'm the one sitting in the centre. I'm teaching Python at CATFOSS now ( moulding more more nerds in my image to be exact ). And I know it should not be allowed but its a pretty cool way to spend time. I realize now why Pramode Sir enjoys teaching so much, you never stop learning when you teach. And as for my students, they are a pretty cool batch. Really friendly and stuff. They are doing some cool projects here. I'll be writing in more detail about my life here soon.

item.title: Work can be fun, can't it???
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: When I passed out of college, I was offered a job (two jobs actually, but one doesn't count :) ); but I opted for the enormously risky, but the extremely fun adventure of a self startup company. This was about four months ago. I still have those jobs and we're ( Mahesh, Sreeraj and me ) running our company. Four months into it, I think i can confidently say  " THIS IS IT!!, I've found something i wanna do ". I possibly work much more than i would've if i had only taken that job. But that comes with the territory, I guess :P . I've got a lot to do. But I'm making this post anyway ( even though i don't think its worth the read ) because of this inspiring post i found on my friend's profile on facebook.

item.title: Connecting to BSNL Broadband using Ubuntu 9.10
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded: So I have this friend who was a new Ubuntu user who wanted to connect to the internet using a broadband BSNL connection. She asked me how. I told her to use pppoeconf ( which another friend suggested ). Unfortunately it didn't quite work. She had this broadband modem which was connected to her box via USB. I still haven't figured out how to connect via the USB interface ( you are welcome to enlighten me ) but if you have access to a LAN Cable and can connect it to your modem then follow these steps : go to your terminal and run the following command : $ pppoeconf its probably found by default in most Ubuntu installations. Install it from your synaptic package manager if you don't have it. You will get a screen that looks like this : From here you just press the Enter key at all screens ( just like in Windows, eh? :) ) until you get to this screen : You have to choose the <No> option there. You have to remember that pppoeconf is written to configure DSL providers all over the world and their authentication protocols and formats in which you enter the username or password can be different. Once this is done you will have to give the <Yes> option at a few more screens and viola ! you are done. If you lose your connection at any time just run $ pon dsl-provider and you'll come back online.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: If I have changed the config file at your 2nd steps without keeping back up, is there any away to cinfigure fresh PPPoE?

not really sure. I played around with the conf file until i got it working and figured that if i don't allow ppoeconf to change settings i'd get a working setup. But since someone asked i'll check it out :)
Hi..need help i took a tata broadband connection...can you help me configure it on ubuntu 9.04
Thanx, it worked on Ubuntu 10.04 with the BSNL Teracom ADSL as well. Any idea why is it that we have to not remove the nodetach and keep the other two options?

item.title: Deploying Your Django Application using Apache and mod_wsgi on your Web Server
item.dc:creator: kpnunni
item.content:encoded:
So I've been playing around with python-django for quite some time now. Developing the applications are simple enough. But deploying them on an actual web server can be a pain in the arse. The official documentation page does give a lot of information on this topic, but you need to do a lot of tinkering to get it just right. Also if you are doing this for the first time you will need to read a lot of stuff from a lot of different places. It took me some time to figure out the whole thing, so I decided to put it all together in one place. I was setting up a server with Ubuntu 11.04 installed (Its always a good idea to use a linux based distro for your server). Before getting started you need a few things set up. First up is installing your web server. I used apache. Go to your terminal and:
sudo apt-get install apache2
Next you need mod_wsgi to run your python code
sudo apt-get install libapache2-mod-wsgi
Now that we have the necessary software setup, we need to configure them to serve your django application. Decide where you want your code to reside in your system. It can be anywhere. Let us say that we are displaying
